bibl.title: Divide and Edit. A Brief History of Book Divisions.
bibl.note: I. Introduction. - II. How authors refer to texts. - III. Evidence for differing book divisions in Antiquity. - IV. Composition by book. - V. Cicero and authors of the early Empire. - VI. Conclusion. "Book divisions, which may have been created by Ephorus as a way of organizing his universal history, seem to have been taken over by later historians, such as Polybius and Diodorus Siculus. The Alexandrians recognized this device as a useful one and applied it to the texts which they edited."
